text: Charles John "Charlie" O'Donnell (August 12, 1932 â€“ November 1, 2010) was an American radio and television announcer. He was best known for Wheel of Fortune, where he worked from 1975 to 1980, and again from 1989 until his death. He was also known for announcing American Bandstand. He died at his home in Sherman Oaks, California, of congestive heart failure at the age of 78 on the morning of November 1, 2010. Category:American television personalities Category:American radio personalities Category:1932 births Category:2010 deaths
title: Charlie O'Donnell
